com.immortallabs.cardboard.game
Class SetsBoard

java.lang.Object
  com.immortallabs.cardboard.game.SetsBoard

public class SetsBoard
extends java.lang.Object

The SetsBoard class models the state of the game board by keeping track of what Cards are in the in-lay and what Cards are on the game board. Also the SetsBoard class determines what is a set and can return information about the game board.



Operations:
  • The SetsBoard class can give a card from the game board.
  • The SetsBoard class can clear the in-lay.
  • The SetsBoard class can move Cards from the in-lay back to the game board.
  • The SetsBoard class can give the amount of rows in the game board.
  • The SetsBoard class can check for sets both on the game board and in the in-lay.
  • The SetsBoard class can give the amount of Cards in the .
  • The SetsBoard class can support Hint functionality.

Version:
0.2, 12/04/08
Author:
Ryan S. Lange
See Also:
Natural, Card, Deck
Version History:
- 01/10/09 0.3 Added source code
- 12/04/08 0.2 Added Version History & pseudocode
- 12/01/08 0.1 Initial Class Skeleton

Constructor Detail

SetsBoard

public SetsBoard(boolean aBeginner,
                 boolean shuff)
Initializes the SetsBoard

Parameters:
aBeginner - True for beginner mode (27 Cards)
shuff - True if deck is to be shuffled for testing
Method Detail

addThreeMore

public void addThreeMore()
If a set is selected and removed from the game board: Adds three new cards in old cards positions. If there is not a set on the board: Adds a row and three more Cards to the game board.

boardContainsSet

public boolean boardContainsSet()
Returns true if there are Cards that constitute a set. Returns false if there are not any Cards that constitute a set. The Cards that are used to test for a set come from both the in-lay and the game board or all the Cards that are currently in play.

Returns:
true if the game board contains a set. false if the game board does not contain a set.

Returns:
index of the Card in the game board.

public boolean checkForSet(Card card1,
                           Card card2,
                           Card card3)
Verifies that three given Cards constitute a set

Parameters:
card1 - first Card
card2 - second Card
card3 - third Card
Returns:
true if the three Cards constitute a set false if the three Cards do not constitute a set

public boolean doHint()
Moves a Card from a set on the board to the in-lay.

Returns:
true if the move to the in-lay was a success false if the move to the in-lay was a failure

Produces a String explaining why or why not the set in the in-lay does or does not constitute a proper set.

Returns:
String explaining the set.

isInlaySet

public boolean isInlaySet()
Returns true if the Cards in the in-lay constitute a set. Returns false if the Cards in the in-lay do not constitute a set.

Returns:
true if there is a set in the in-lay. false if there is not a set in the in-lay.

public boolean moveCardToInlay(Card theCard,
                               java.lang.Boolean isHint)
Moves the Card to the in-lay.

Parameters:
theCard - : theCard to move to the in-lay.
isHint - : if true than card is being moved to in-lay due to using a hint. if false than card was chosen by the player.
Returns:
: true if the move to the in-lay was a success false if the move to the in-lay was a failure
